intro: Mallotus spodocarpus, commonly known as the broadleaf holly, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height, featuring thick, rough bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing one or two seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
